abstract: American companies investing in Myanmar must detail in public reports steps they have taken to respect human and labor rights, to protect environment and to avoid corruption; requirement was established when Obama administration lifted economic sanctions on country.

headline.main: U.S. Companies Investing in Myanmar Must Show Steps to Respect Human Rights
headline.print_headline: U.S. Companies Investing in Myanmar Must Show Steps to Respect Human Rights

lead_paragraph: The reporting requirement represents a novel effort to shape business practices in an emerging economy that has embarked on tentative reform.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

snippet: The reporting requirement represents a novel effort to shape business practices in an emerging economy that has embarked on tentative reform.
